###Q1 Generating normal random variables

####a: Using central limit theorem
```{r}
Nsims = 50000
Nvec = numeric(Nsims)
i = 0
while(i < Nsims){
  N = sum(runif(12)) - 6
  Nvec[i] = N
  i = i + 1
}
length(Nvec)
hist(Nvec)
```

####b: Using Box Muller

```{r}
Nvec = numeric(Nsims)
i = 0
while(i < Nsims){
  u1 = runif(1)
  u2 = runif(1)
  r = sqrt(-2 * log(u1))
  theta = 2 * pi * u2
  x = r * cos(theta)
  y = r * sin(theta)
  Nvec[i] = x
  Nvec[i+1] = y
  i = i + 2
}
length(Nvec)
hist(Nvec)
```

####c: Using Polar-Mascaglia
```{r}
Nvec = numeric(Nsims)
i = 0
while(i < Nsims){
  u1 = runif(1)
  u2 = runif(1)
  v1 = (2*u1)-1
  v2 = (2*u2)-1
  S = v1^2 + v2^2
  if(S < 1){ # inside the unit circle
    i = i + 2
    foo = sqrt((-2 * log(S))/S)
    x = foo * v1
    y = foo * v2
    Nvec[i] = x
    Nvec[i+1] = y
  }
}
length(Nvec)
hist(Nvec)
```

####d: Using Ratio of Uniforms

```{r}
Nvec = numeric(Nsims)
i = 0
while(i < Nsims){
  u = runif(1, 0, 1)
  v = runif(1, -1, 1)
  if(v^2 < -4 * u^2 * log(u)){ # test
    i = i + 1
    Nvec[i] = v/u
  }
}
length(Nvec)
hist(Nvec)
```
